applyDefaultValues.name: applyDefaultValues
applyDefaultValues.short_desc: Applies default values to this object.
applyDefaultValues.long_desc:
This method should be called from the object's constructor (or
equivalent initialization method).

__construct.name: __construct
__construct.short_desc: Initializes internal state of Thelia\Model\Base\Message object.

isModified.name: isModified
isModified.short_desc: Returns whether the object has been modified.
isModified.hint_desc: True if the object has been modified.

col.name: col
col.short_desc: column fully qualified name (TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME), e.g. Book::AUTHOR_ID

getModifiedColumns.name: getModifiedColumns
getModifiedColumns.short_desc: Get the columns that have been modified in this object.
getModifiedColumns.hint_desc: A unique list of the modified column names for this object.

isNew.name: isNew
isNew.short_desc: Returns whether the object has ever been saved.
isNew.long_desc:
This will
be false, if the object was retrieved from storage or was created
and then saved.
isNew.hint_desc: true, if the object has never been persisted.

setNew.name: setNew
setNew.long_desc:
This method will be called
by Propel-generated children and objects.

isDeleted.name: isDeleted
isDeleted.short_desc: Whether this object has been deleted.
isDeleted.hint_desc: The deleted state of this object.

setDeleted.name: setDeleted
setDeleted.short_desc: Specify whether this object has been deleted.

b.name: b
b.short_desc: The deleted state of this object.

resetModified.name: resetModified
resetModified.short_desc: Sets the modified state for the object to be false.

col.name: col
col.short_desc: If supplied, only the specified column is reset.

equals.name: equals
equals.long_desc: If obj is an instance of Message, delegates to equals(Message). Otherwise, returns false.
equals.hint_desc: Whether equal to the object specified.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.short_desc: If the primary key is not null, return the hashcode of the primary key.
hashCode.long_desc: Otherwise, return the hash code of the object.

getVirtualColumns.name: getVirtualColumns
getVirtualColumns.short_desc: Get the associative array of the virtual columns in this object

hasVirtualColumn.short_desc: Checks the existence of a virtual column in this object

getVirtualColumn.short_desc: Get the value of a virtual column in this object

setVirtualColumn.short_desc: Set the value of a virtual column in this object
setVirtualColumn.hint_desc: The current object, for fluid interface

value.name: value
value.short_desc: The value to give to the virtual column

importFrom.name: importFrom
importFrom.short_desc: Populate the current object from a string, using a given parser format $book = new Book(); $book->importFrom('JSON', '{"Id":9012,"Title":"Don Juan","ISBN":"0140422161","Price":12.99,"PublisherId":1234,"AuthorId":5678}');
importFrom.hint_desc: The current object, for fluid interface

parser.name: parser
parser.short_desc: A AbstractParser instance, or a format name ('XML', 'YAML', 'JSON', 'CSV')

data.name: data
data.short_desc: The source data to import from

exportTo.name: exportTo
exportTo.short_desc: Export the current object properties to a string, using a given parser format $book = BookQuery::create()->findPk(9012); echo $book->exportTo('JSON'); => {"Id":9012,"Title":"Don Juan","ISBN":"0140422161","Price":12.99,"PublisherId":1234,"AuthorId":5678}');

parser.name: parser
parser.short_desc: A AbstractParser instance, or a format name ('XML', 'YAML', 'JSON', 'CSV')

includeLazyLoadColumns.name: includeLazyLoadColumns
includeLazyLoadColumns.short_desc: (optional) Whether to include lazy load(ed) columns. Defaults to TRUE.

__sleep.name: __sleep
__sleep.short_desc: Clean up internal collections prior to serializing Avoids recursive loops that turn into segmentation faults when serializing

getCreatedAt.name: getCreatedAt
getCreatedAt.short_desc: Get the [optionally formatted] temporal [created_at] column value.
getCreatedAt.hint_desc: Formatted date/time value as string or \DateTime object (if format is NULL), NULL if column is NULL, and 0 if column value is 0000-00-00 00:00:00
exceptions: - if unable to parse/validate the date/time value.

format.name: format
format.short_desc: The date/time format string (either date()-style or strftime()-style). If format is NULL, then the raw \DateTime object will be returned.

exceptions: - if unable to parse/validate the date/time value.

hasOnlyDefaultValues.name: hasOnlyDefaultValues
hasOnlyDefaultValues.short_desc: Indicates whether the columns in this object are only set to default values.
hasOnlyDefaultValues.long_desc:
This method can be used in conjunction with isModified() to indicate whether an object is both
modified _and_ has some values set which are non-default.
hasOnlyDefaultValues.hint_desc: Whether the columns in this object are only been set with default values.

hydrate.name: hydrate
hydrate.short_desc: Hydrates (populates) the object variables with values from the database resultset.
hydrate.long_desc:
An offset (0-based "start column") is specified so that objects can be hydrated
with a subset of the columns in the resultset rows.  This is needed, for example,
for results of JOIN queries where the resultset row includes columns from two or
more tables.
exceptions: - Any caught Exception will be rewrapped as a PropelException.

startcol.name: startcol
startcol.short_desc: 0-based offset column which indicates which restultset column to start with.

rehydrate.name: rehydrate
rehydrate.short_desc: Whether this object is being re-hydrated from the database.

indexType.name: indexType
indexType.short_desc: The index type of $row. Mostly DataFetcher->getIndexType(). One of the class type constants TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_STUDLYPHPNAME TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME, TableMap::TYPE_FIELDNAME, TableMap::TYPE_NUM.

ensureConsistency.name: ensureConsistency
ensureConsistency.short_desc: Checks and repairs the internal consistency of the object.
ensureConsistency.long_desc:
This method is executed after an already-instantiated object is re-hydrated
from the database.  It exists to check any foreign keys to make sure that
the objects related to the current object are correct based on foreign key.

You can override this method in the stub class, but you should always invoke
the base method from the overridden method (i.e. parent::ensureConsistency()),
in case your model changes.

reload.name: reload
reload.short_desc: Reloads this object from datastore based on primary key and (optionally) resets all associated objects.
reload.long_desc: This will only work if the object has been saved and has a valid primary key set.
exceptions: - if this object is deleted, unsaved or doesn't have pk match in db

deep.name: deep
deep.short_desc: (optional) Whether to also de-associated any related objects.

delete.name: delete
delete.short_desc: Removes this object from datastore and sets delete attribute.

save.name: save
save.short_desc: Persists this object to the database.
save.long_desc:
If the object is new, it inserts it; otherwise an update is performed.
All modified related objects will also be persisted in the doSave()
method.  This method wraps all precipitate database operations in a
single transaction.
save.hint_desc: The number of rows affected by this insert/update and any referring fk objects' save() operations.

getByName.name: getByName
getByName.short_desc: Retrieves a field from the object by name passed in as a string.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: The type of fieldname the $name is of: one of the class type constants TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_STUDLYPHPNAME TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME, TableMap::TYPE_FIELDNAME, TableMap::TYPE_NUM. Defaults to TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME.

getByPosition.name: getByPosition
getByPosition.short_desc: Retrieves a field from the object by Position as specified in the xml schema.

toArray.name: toArray
toArray.short_desc: Exports the object as an array.
toArray.long_desc:
You can specify the key type of the array by passing one of the class
type constants.
toArray.hint_desc: an associative array containing the field names (as keys) and field values

keyType.name: keyType
keyType.short_desc: (optional) One of the class type constants TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_STUDLYPHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME, TableMap::TYPE_FIELDNAME, TableMap::TYPE_NUM. Defaults to TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME.

includeLazyLoadColumns.name: includeLazyLoadColumns
includeLazyLoadColumns.short_desc: (optional) Whether to include lazy loaded columns. Defaults to TRUE.

alreadyDumpedObjects.name: alreadyDumpedObjects
alreadyDumpedObjects.short_desc: List of objects to skip to avoid recursion

includeForeignObjects.name: includeForeignObjects
includeForeignObjects.short_desc: (optional) Whether to include hydrated related objects. Default to FALSE.

setByName.name: setByName
setByName.short_desc: Sets a field from the object by name passed in as a string.

type.name: type
type.short_desc: The type of fieldname the $name is of: one of the class type constants TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_STUDLYPHPNAME TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME, TableMap::TYPE_FIELDNAME, TableMap::TYPE_NUM. Defaults to TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME.

setByPosition.name: setByPosition
setByPosition.short_desc: Sets a field from the object by Position as specified in the xml schema.

fromArray.name: fromArray
fromArray.short_desc: Populates the object using an array.
fromArray.long_desc:
This is particularly useful when populating an object from one of the
request arrays (e.g. $_POST).  This method goes through the column
names, checking to see whether a matching key exists in populated
array. If so the setByName() method is called for that column.

You can specify the key type of the array by additionally passing one
of the class type constants TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME, TableMap::TYPE_STUDLYPHPNAME,
TableMap::TYPE_COLNAME, TableMap::TYPE_FIELDNAME, TableMap::TYPE_NUM.
The default key type is the column's TableMap::TYPE_PHPNAME.

arr.name: arr
arr.short_desc: An array to populate the object from.

keyType.name: keyType
keyType.short_desc: The type of keys the array uses.

buildCriteria.name: buildCriteria
buildCriteria.short_desc: Build a Criteria object containing the values of all modified columns in this object.
buildCriteria.hint_desc: The Criteria object containing all modified values.

buildPkeyCriteria.name: buildPkeyCriteria
buildPkeyCriteria.short_desc: Builds a Criteria object containing the primary key for this object.
buildPkeyCriteria.long_desc:
Unlike buildCriteria() this method includes the primary key values regardless
of whether or not they have been modified.
buildPkeyCriteria.hint_desc: The Criteria object containing value(s) for primary key(s).

getPrimaryKey.name: getPrimaryKey
getPrimaryKey.short_desc: Returns the primary key for this object (row).

setPrimaryKey.name: setPrimaryKey
setPrimaryKey.short_desc: Generic method to set the primary key (id column).

isPrimaryKeyNull.name: isPrimaryKeyNull
isPrimaryKeyNull.short_desc: Returns true if the primary key for this object is null.

copyInto.name: copyInto
copyInto.short_desc: Sets contents of passed object to values from current object.
copyInto.long_desc:
If desired, this method can also make copies of all associated (fkey referrers)
objects.

deepCopy.name: deepCopy
deepCopy.short_desc: Whether to also copy all rows that refer (by fkey) to the current row.

makeNew.name: makeNew
makeNew.short_desc: Whether to reset autoincrement PKs and make the object new.

copy.name: copy
copy.short_desc: Makes a copy of this object that will be inserted as a new row in table when saved.
copy.long_desc:
It creates a new object filling in the simple attributes, but skipping any primary
keys that are defined for the table.

If desired, this method can also make copies of all associated (fkey referrers)
objects.

deepCopy.name: deepCopy
deepCopy.short_desc: Whether to also copy all rows that refer (by fkey) to the current row.

initRelation.name: initRelation
initRelation.short_desc: Initializes a collection based on the name of a relation.
initRelation.long_desc:
Avoids crafting an 'init[$relationName]s' method name
that wouldn't work when StandardEnglishPluralizer is used.

relationName.name: relationName
relationName.short_desc: The name of the relation to initialize

clearMessageI18ns.name: clearMessageI18ns
clearMessageI18ns.long_desc:
This does not modify the database; however, it will remove any associated objects, causing
them to be refetched by subsequent calls to accessor method.

resetPartialMessageI18ns.name: resetPartialMessageI18ns
resetPartialMessageI18ns.short_desc: Reset is the collMessageI18ns collection loaded partially.

initMessageI18ns.name: initMessageI18ns

overrideExisting.name: overrideExisting
overrideExisting.short_desc: If set to true, the method call initializes the collection even if it is not empty

getMessageI18ns.name: getMessageI18ns
getMessageI18ns.short_desc: Gets an array of ChildMessageI18n objects which contain a foreign key that references this object.
getMessageI18ns.long_desc:
If the $criteria is not null, it is used to always fetch the results from the database.
Otherwise the results are fetched from the database the first time, then cached.
Next time the same method is called without $criteria, the cached collection is returned.
If this ChildMessage is new, it will return
an empty collection or the current collection; the criteria is ignored on a new object.

criteria.name: criteria
criteria.short_desc: optional Criteria object to narrow the query

setMessageI18ns.name: setMessageI18ns
setMessageI18ns.short_desc: Sets a collection of MessageI18n objects related by a one-to-many relationship to the current object.
setMessageI18ns.long_desc:
It will also schedule objects for deletion based on a diff between old objects (aka persisted)
and new objects from the given Propel collection.
setMessageI18ns.hint_desc: The current object (for fluent API support)

countMessageI18ns.name: countMessageI18ns
countMessageI18ns.short_desc: Returns the number of related MessageI18n objects.

addMessageI18n.name: addMessageI18n
addMessageI18n.short_desc: Method called to associate a ChildMessageI18n object to this object through the ChildMessageI18n foreign key attribute.
addMessageI18n.hint_desc: The current object (for fluent API support)

removeMessageI18n.name: removeMessageI18n
removeMessageI18n.hint_desc: The current object (for fluent API support)

This does not modify the database; however, it will remove any associated objects, causing
them to be refetched by subsequent calls to accessor method.

getMessageVersions.long_desc:
If the $criteria is not null, it is used to always fetch the results from the database.
Otherwise the results are fetched from the database the first time, then cached.
Next time the same method is called without $criteria, the cached collection is returned.
If this ChildMessage is new, it will return
an empty collection or the current collection; the criteria is ignored on a new object.

criteria.name: criteria

clear.short_desc: Clears the current object and sets all attributes to their default values

clearAllReferences.name: clearAllReferences
clearAllReferences.short_desc: Resets all references to other model objects or collections of model objects.
clearAllReferences.long_desc:
This method is a user-space workaround for PHP's inability to garbage collect
objects with circular references (even in PHP 5.3). This is currently necessary
when using Propel in certain daemon or large-volume/high-memory operations.

deep.name: deep
deep.short_desc: Whether to also clear the references on all referrer objects.

loadedObjects.name: loadedObjects

getLastVersionNumber.name: getLastVersionNumber

isLastVersion.name: isLastVersion

getOneVersion.name: getOneVersion
getOneVersion.short_desc: Retrieves a version object for this entity and a version number

getAllVersions.name: getAllVersions
getAllVersions.short_desc: Gets all the versions of this object, in incremental order

compareVersion.name: compareVersion
compareVersion.short_desc: Compares the current object with another of its version.
compareVersion.long_desc: print_r($book->compareVersion(1)); => array( '1' => array('Title' => 'Book title at version 1'), '2' => array('Title' => 'Book title at version 2') );

keys.name: keys
keys.short_desc: Main key used for the result diff (versions|columns)

ignoredColumns.name: ignoredColumns
ignoredColumns.short_desc: The columns to exclude from the diff.

compareVersions.name: compareVersions
compareVersions.short_desc: Compares two versions of the current object.
compareVersions.long_desc: print_r($book->compareVersions(1, 2)); => array( '1' => array('Title' => 'Book title at version 1'), '2' => array('Title' => 'Book title at version 2') );

keys.name: keys
keys.short_desc: Main key used for the result diff (versions|columns)

ignoredColumns.name: ignoredColumns
ignoredColumns.short_desc: The columns to exclude from the diff.

__call.name: __call
__call.short_desc: Derived method to catches calls to undefined methods.
__call.long_desc:
Provides magic import/export method support (fromXML()/toXML(), fromYAML()/toYAML(), etc.).
Allows to define default __call() behavior if you overwrite __call()
